answers.answer: Hi,How are you?The diagnosis will depend upon the clinical correlation between your symptoms and MRI findings.What symptoms do you have?White matter lesions can be seen in smokers, and due to old age, alcoholism, diabetes, high BP, viral illnesses, migraine, chronic headache, MS and Alzheimer’s disease.LP findings will help in diagnosing the cause of these white matter lesions like MS.Please go ahead and get them done.

so far just  strong muscle spasms in my right foot. I also have Rheumatoid Arthritis.Dr. says my dry mouth problems are related to that.I also have attacks of anxiety   and of coarse depression all the time. I am on Remeron for the depression and atavan for the anxiety. I sometimes have to take a sedative to sleep.Zopiclone. So now he has me on amitriptyline too. If I take to Zop I don't take the amitriptyline.
I mentioned that I quit smoking  but forgot to mention that I apparently have had some minor strokes too.

question: I have results of an MRI. I am not fluent in doctor speak. reason for exam left parasagittal tumor?Is deep white matter high signal intensity in the brain a normal happening? There are also numerous regions of High intensity with in the subcortiical and deep white matter bilateral cerebral hemispheres.I am totally lost. GOOD or BAD news.???I am a 62 yr old female who quit smioking last march., after 45 yrs of slow death.MRI Impression---several scattered foci of FLAIR and T2 hyperintensity as described above. the findings are non specific but demyelination such as M.S or deep white matter ischemic changes should be considered. Further clinical evaluation for MS give the patients relatively young age would be of benefit. No evedence of a left parasagittal mass demonstrated.A lumbar puncture and EVOKEe potential testing are now ordere by my neurologist..
